item.title: 债权人行使抵押品赎回权后入股Allianca和Light
item.description: 曾为问题资产投资者纳尔逊·塔努雷提供融资的债权人，在执行其收购利加电信公司交易中作为抵押品的股份后，着手扣押其在Allianca Saude e Participacoes SA和Light SA的部分股权。【原文：Creditors who financed troubled-asset investor Nelson Tanure moved to seize part of his stakes in Allianca Saude e Participacoes SA and Light SA after executing shares pledged as collateral in a transaction tied to his acquisition of Ligga Telecomunicacoes SA.】

item.title: 泰国大选胜利为投资者带来政策延续性
item.description: 泰国执政党为泰党在周日选举中取得压倒性胜利，部分策略师和经济学家认为这将提振该国股市和货币。政策延续性的可能性令担忧政治功能失调加剧的投资者松了一口气。【原文：A convincing win by Thailand’s ruling Bhumjaithai Party in Sunday’s election should boost the country’s stock market and currency, according to some strategists and economists, with the potential for policy continuity a relief for investors who’d feared further political dysfunction.】

item.title: 贝森特认为中国"不守规矩"的交易行为是金价波动的幕后推手
item.description: 财政部长斯科特·贝森特指出，中国交易员是上周黄金市场剧烈波动的原因之一。【原文：Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent cited Chinese traders as a reason behind last week’s wild swings in the gold market.】

item.title: 奥卡多或裁员近千人为削减成本：《泰晤士报》报道
item.description: 据《泰晤士报》报道，食品杂货科技公司奥卡多集团正计划大幅裁员，以重启削减成本的举措。【原文：Ocado Group Plc is planning to slash a significant number of jobs as the grocery technology firm renews efforts to cut costs, the Times newspaper reported.】

item.title: 高盛交易员警告：震荡市场中股票抛售尚未结束
item.description: 高盛集团交易部门称，美国股市上周五反弹几乎抹平了本周中期惨烈的跌幅，但本周将面临趋势跟随型算法基金的进一步抛售。【原文：After rebounding Friday to nearly erase a brutal mid-week slide, US stocks are facing more selling this week from trend-following algorithmic funds, according to Goldman Sachs Group Inc.’s trading desk.】

item.title: 监管机构失误后，埃斯孔电力公司可通过调高电价筹集34亿美元
item.description: 南非能源监管机构已批准国有企业埃斯康姆控股公司（Eskom Holdings SOC Ltd.）上调电价，并在三年内收回547亿兰特（约合34亿美元）的损失。此前该公司因一系列定价失误，且私下解决此事的尝试失败。【原文：South Africa’s energy regulator has allowed state-owned Eskom Holdings SOC Ltd. to raise tariffs and recover 54.7 billion rand ($3.4 billion) over three years after a series of pricing errors and a failed attempt to settle the matter privately.】

item.title: 博彩股走低，预测市场抢走超级碗投注
item.description: 超级碗本应是博彩公司年度日程中的重头戏。然而今年，随着这场盛大赛事的临近，整个行业却笼罩在阴云之下。【原文：The Super Bowl is supposed to be the highlight of the calendar for gambling companies. This year, though, a cloud has descended over the industry as the big game approached.】

item.title: 股市剧烈波动令华尔街最受欢迎的期权交易持续活跃
item.description: 欧美股市局部板块的波动尚未蔓延至更广泛的指数，这提振了押注市场进一步分化的期权策略需求。【原文：The volatility in pockets of the European and US equity markets has yet to engulf the broader indexes, boosting demand for option strategies betting on further dispersion.】

item.title: 沙特将公布2万亿美元经济计划的更新战略
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯计划发布更新版战略，以推进王储穆罕默德·本·萨勒曼的2万亿美元经济多元化议程。该王国正面临财政压力，正据此调整政策和支出优先事项。【原文：Saudi Arabia plans to release an updated strategy for Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman’s $2 trillion economic diversification agenda as the kingdom adjusts its policies and spending priorities amid fiscal pressures.】

item.title: KKR将Arctos视为构建百亿美元业务的关键枢纽
item.description: KKR & Co.的高管们认为，收购Arctos Partners对公司至关重要，这将助力其把握两大增长业务线带来的机遇，同时巩固其作为主导性机构体育投资者的新地位。【原文：KKR & Co.’s leaders see their acquisition of Arctos Partners as key to helping the firm capitalize on two growing business lines while strengthening its newfound position as a dominant institutional sports investor.】

item.title: 人工智能恐惧笼罩华尔街，股市新常态渐成定局
item.description: 数月来，投资者对人工智能可能如何改变经济格局的担忧日益加剧。上周，这些忧虑突然蔓延至股市。【原文：For months, investors have been growing increasingly anxious about how artificial intelligence will potentially transform the economy. Last week, those concerns suddenly spilled over into the stock market.】

item.title: 日本高市早苗承诺财政可持续性，加快减税谈判
item.description: 日本首相高市早苗在投票结束后首次发表讲话时，坚持对财政政策和消费税减免采取谨慎立场。其执政党有望取得压倒性胜利。【原文：Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi stuck to a cautious line on fiscal policy and a sales tax reduction in her first comments since polls closed with her ruling party on track for a landslide victory.】

item.title: 部分新兴企业似乎比政府更值得信赖
item.description: 越来越多的新兴市场企业正以低于本国利率的成本在海外融资，这表明主权风险对实力较强、出口导向型企业造成的拖累正在减弱。【原文：Growing numbers of emerging-market companies are borrowing overseas at cheaper rates than their countries of origin, a sign that sovereign risk is becoming less of a drag for the stronger, export-focused names.】

item.title: 苹果准备在2026年推出iPhone 17e、新款iPad和Mac电脑
item.description: 苹果公司将于2026年启动产品攻势，推出iPhone 17e、更新版iPad及新款Mac电脑。此外：在全体员工大会上，首席执行官蒂姆·库克就移民政策、人工智能及公司50周年庆典向员工传达了具体指示。最后，这家iPhone制造商缩减了重大新健康服务的计划。【原文：Apple is going to begin a 2026 product blitz with the iPhone 17e, updated iPads and fresh Macs. Also: Here’s exactly what CEO Tim Cook told employees about immigration, artificial intelligence and the company’s 50th anniversary during an all-hands meeting. Lastly, the iPhone maker scales back plans for a major new health service.】

item.title: 欧洲央行将在3月评估欧元走强影响，西波隆表示
item.description: 欧洲央行执行委员会成员皮耶罗·奇波隆内向塞浦路斯通讯社表示，该行将在3月发布的季度预测中评估欧元近期升值对消费者价格增长的影响，但近期汇率波动幅度相当有限。【原文：The European Central Bank will assess the effects of the euro’s recent rally on consumer-price growth in its quarterly forecasts due in March, but recent moves have been rather limited, Executive Board member Piero Cipollone told Cyprus News Agency.】

item.title: 高市裕子获胜推动日股上涨，日元与债券承压
item.description: 日本股市有望在未来数周乃至数月延续涨势，而该国货币和债券则可能进一步走弱。此前在周日众议院选举中，首相高市早苗领导的自民党表现强劲。【原文：Japan’s stock market is poised to extend its rally in the weeks and months ahead while the nation’s currency and bonds are vulnerable to further declines after a strong showing by Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s Liberal Democratic Party in Sunday’s lower house election.】

item.title: 日本NHK民调显示高市早苗有望赢得压倒性选举胜利
item.description: 日本首相高市早苗有望赢得压倒性胜利，民调显示其所属政党将在周日的众议院选举中取得绝对多数席位。【原文：Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi is set to secure a resounding victory, with polls showing her party on track to emerge from Sunday’s parliamentary election with a standalone majority in the lower house.】

item.title: 沙特企业同意重建叙利亚航空和移动通信网络
item.description: 沙特企业已达成协议，将协助支持叙利亚的电信和航空业。该国在经历多年战乱后，正致力于重建核心基础设施。【原文：Saudi firms have struck deals to help support Syria’s telecommunications and aviation industries, as the country looks to rebuild core infrastructure after years of war.】

item.title: 泰国下任总理将在开放式选举后产生
item.description: 随着周日投票结束并开始计票，泰国下一任领导人即将诞生。这场民主改革派与保守派之间的角逐，可能加剧该国政治僵局。【原文：Thailand’s next leader is set to emerge as polls closed Sunday and counting of votes started in a contest between pro-democracy reformers and status-quo conservatives that risks deepening the country’s political paralysis.】

item.title: xAI的巴布什金称尚未购置伦敦顶层公寓
item.description: 埃隆·马斯克旗下xAI公司的联合创始人伊戈尔·巴布什金回应彭博社报道称，他"不打算在英国购买任何房产"。此前有报道称他已同意以约5700万英镑（合7760万美元）的价格购入一处俯瞰伦敦海德公园的顶层公寓。【原文：Igor Babuschkin, co-founder of Elon Musk’s xAI, said he is “not planning to purchase any property in the UK,” responding to a Bloomberg report that he had agreed to buy a penthouse overlooking London’s Hyde Park for about £57 million ($77.6 million).】

item.title: 日本选民将对高市早苗的领导力作出评判
item.description: 日本选民将于周日前往投票站，对首相高市早苗的政府作出评判。她正试图巩固执政地位，并为其引发部分投资者不安的支出与投资计划争取明确授权。【原文：Japanese voters head to the polls Sunday to deliver a verdict on Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s government as she seeks to shore up her grip on power and gain a clear mandate for spending and investment plans that have unsettled some investors.】

item.title: 多尔西旗下Block公司为提升效率裁员近一成
item.description: 杰克·多尔西旗下的Block公司正通知数百名员工，在年度绩效评估期间其岗位可能被裁撤。这家支付公司正着手进行更广泛的业务重组。【原文：Jack Dorsey’s Block Inc. has been notifying hundreds of employees that their jobs may be eliminated during annual performance reviews as the payments firm embarks on a broader business overhaul.】

item.title: 美国就业与通胀双重打击即将来袭
item.description: 投资者和政策制定者正为即将到来的繁忙一周做准备，本周将发布多项美国经济报告，其中包括堪称最具影响力的两项数据快照——就业和通胀数据。【原文：Investors and policymakers are gearing up for a busy week of US economic reports that includes arguably the two most consequential data snapshots — employment and inflation.】

item.title: 科技公司的人工智能扩张可能引发债券市场反弹：《信贷周刊》
item.description: 科技巨头正准备在人工智能领域投入比投资者预期更多的资金，而基金经理们日益担忧，无论发生什么情况，信贷市场都将受到冲击。【原文：The biggest tech companies are gearing up to spend even more on artificial intelligence than investors had anticipated, and money managers increasingly fear that whatever happens, credit markets will get hit.】

item.title: 动荡交易周在美国股市版图上留下坑坑洼洼
item.description: 贵金属热潮退去，比特币行情熄火，劳动力市场似乎也渐趋疲软。这些动荡虽非始于股市，但叠加软件企业的清算浪潮，已足以撼动人工智能驱动的牛市根基。【原文：Precious metals memed out, Bitcoin flamed out and the labor market looks like it’s petering out. None of it started in the equities market, but together it was enough — along with a reckoning for software firms — to shake the foundation of an AI-driven bull run.】

item.title: 深陷债务泥潭，芝加哥最后的赛马场时日无多
item.description: 在霍桑赛马场，赛马运动从来都不是什么光鲜的生意。这座建于1891年的小赛场地处芝加哥郊外的工业区，环境艰苦，与城北更时髦的阿灵顿公园赛马场形成鲜明对比。【原文：Horse racing was never really a glamorous business at Hawthorne Race Course. Built in 1891, it’s a hardscrabble, little track tucked into an industrial zone just outside Chicago, a companion venue to the more chic Arlington Park on the city’s north side.】

item.title: 让交易员对天然气市场失去信心的两分钟
item.description:
从错误的交易暂停到关于"收盘前猛攻"的猜测，美国天然气市场正显露紧张迹象。【原文：

From an erroneous trading halt to speculation about “banging the close,” the US gas market is showing signs of strain

】

item.title: 印度为确保与美国达成协议，部分开放5800亿美元农业领域
item.description: 印度提议向美国开放部分农业领域，允许进口更廉价的产品。此举可能降低食品和饲料成本，但会加剧对部分国内农民的压力。【原文：India has proposed opening up parts of its agriculture industry to cheaper imports from the US, a move that may lower food and feed costs but intensify pressure on some domestic farmers.】

item.title: 私募市场争夺全球富豪资金遭遇人工智能寒冬
item.description: 私募市场销售人员在争取全球富豪的战线上，对如何应对关于透明度、流动性和估值的质疑已驾轻就熟。如今他们棘手的谈话要点清单上又添新条目——所谓的"SaaS末日"。【原文：The salespeople on the front line of a private-markets push to win over the world’s wealthy are quite adept at fielding questions on opacity, liquidity and valuation. Their list of tricky talking points just got a new addition — the so-called SaaSpocalypse.】

item.title: 加密货币交易所因400亿美元错误将向部分用户退款
item.description: 韩国加密货币交易所Bithumb周五误发价值逾400亿美元的比特币，该平台表示将补偿那些在短暂但剧烈的抛售潮中恐慌性抛售资产而蒙受损失的客户。【原文：South Korean crypto exchange Bithumb, which mistakenly distributed more than $40 billion worth of Bitcoin on Friday, said it will reimburse customers who made losses when they sold their holdings in a panic during a brief but sharp selloff on its platform.】
